page.title: EC2 용어
page.content: IOPS    The requested number of I/O operations per second that the volume can support. For Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, you can provision up to 50 IOPS per GiB. For General Purpose (SSD) volumes, baseline performance is 3 IOPS per GiB, with a minimum of 100 IOPS and a maximum of 10000 IOPS. General Purpose (SSD) volumes under 1000 GiB can burst up to 3000 IOPS. Learn more about EBS volume types.        Size (GiB)    Volume size must be greater than zero or the size of the snapshot used. Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes must be at least 4 GiB in size.    GiB : 기가바이트.    The capacity of the Amazon EBS volume in GiB. Note that     1 GiB = 1024^3 bytes, whereas 1 GB = 1000^3 bytes.        Snapshot    A snapshot is a backup of an EC2 volume that's stored in S3. You can create a new volume using data stored in a snapshot by entering the snapshot's ID. You can search for public snapshots by typing text in the Snapshot field. Descriptions are case-sensitive.
page.html:
IOPS

The requested number of I/O operations per second that the volume can support. For Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, you can provision up to 50 IOPS per GiB. For General Purpose (SSD) volumes, baseline performance is 3 IOPS per GiB, with a minimum of 100 IOPS and a maximum of 10000 IOPS. General Purpose (SSD) volumes under 1000 GiB can burst up to 3000 IOPS. Learn more about EBS volume types.


Size (GiB)

Volume size must be greater than zero or the size of the snapshot used. Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes must be at least 4 GiB in size.

GiB : 기가바이트.

The capacity of the Amazon EBS volume in GiB. Note that

1 GiB = 1024^3 bytes, whereas 1 GB = 1000^3 bytes.


Snapshot

A snapshot is a backup of an EC2 volume that's stored in S3. You can create a new volume using data stored in a snapshot by entering the snapshot's ID. You can search for public snapshots by typing text in the Snapshot field. Descriptions are case-sensitive.
